CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Admin and Facilities?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Admin and Facilities is arc {Legal Department}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc IT Department?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc IT Department is arc {Human Resources Department}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {IT Department} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Admin and Facilities} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Human Resources Department to Admin and Facilities in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Human Resources Department to IT Department in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Admin and Facilities and Legal Department in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Admin and Facilities and Legal Department is {62}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between IT Department and Legal Department in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between IT Department and Legal Department is {121}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Human Resources Department?
SC.A: The total flow output from Human Resources Department is {171}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Admin and Facilities?
SC.A: The total flow input by Admin and Facilities is {335}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 147? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {174} from {IT Department} to {Admin and Facilities}, a flow of {156} from {Admin and Facilities} to {IT Department}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 67? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {62} from {Legal Department} to {Admin and Facilities}, a flow of {51} from {Admin and Facilities} to {Legal Department}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 91 and 104? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {99} from {Human Resources Department} to {Admin and Facilities}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from IT Department to Admin and Facilities or from IT Department to Human Resources Department?
NC.A: The flow from {IT Department} to {Admin and Facilities} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Admin and Facilities to Legal Department, from Human Resources Department to Admin and Facilities, or from Human Resources Department to IT Department?
NC.A: The flow from {Human Resources Department} to {Admin and Facilities} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Legal Department}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Admin and Facilities} and {IT Department}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Admin and Facilities, Arc IT Department, Arc Legal Department, Arc Human Resources Department}.
